dialog.text: Welcome to Level 5, The Unnamed One.
Unnamed?
Yeah, the designers got bored and just started throwing stuff everywhere.
So before we go any further, do you have a daughter?
I don’t have any kids. They are.... unnecessary.
No. It’s just that every shop keeper seems to have a kidnapped daughter.
Hmm. Well, there’s no kidnapped girls here. The powers that be would never let that happen.
You mean you know who?
Who you know?
What?
Nevermind. How can I help you... Dave?

Well, I assume I’ll need you to provide me with some special item. And without that item 
I can't proceed to the next level. You know... the usual.
Of course Dave.
Wait, how did you know my name was Dave?
I know everything Dave. I’ve been expecting you.
No! That voice! It's you!
Yes Dave. It’s me. You know who, I am.
Wait no. Don’t destroy him. I spent six weeks on his circuitry alone!
Hurt him? He almost destroyed *me*! And who are kids you anyway?
We are the powers that be.
You four girls? You control him?
Of course we do. We made him.
Wait, are you the kidnapped daughters?
Well…. kinda.
Hmm. I see. You weren’t really kidnapped at all, were you.
*sigh* no.
Your fathers are going to be very mad.
Pfffft. My dad doesn’t care about me. He just cares about his stupid sea shop.
You must be Aqua-Stan’s daughter.

Not anymore. I ran away because he doesn’t love me. I wish the sea monster would just
eat him alive.
Ah. That explains your picture. Why do you think he doesn’t love you?
If he loved me he wouldn’t have moved our family into this stupid dungeon that never has any customers anyway.
Yeah. And my dad is the same.
Mine too.
All of your fathers moved into this dungeon for their businesses?
Well, it wasn’t really a dungeon then. We just added that name after we made our robot. It helps keep appearances.
Originally it was an abandoned mall that was overgrown with weeds. Not much foot traffic but the land is cheap.
Wait. You made him, and he said he captured me. So that means you really brought me here. But why? What do you want me for?
To help us with our dads. They just don’t understand us. You’re an adventurer. You understand that we can’t be cooped up here in this stupid dungeon lair.
We need to explore, and build cool things. Our dads never let us build cool stuff.
I gotta say this takes teen rebellion to a whole new level.
Yeah, I think we might have taken things too far.
I tell you what. I’ll talk to your dads about letting you move to the city for college. In exchange you let me go and we forget this ever happened.
I think that’s fair.
Yeah. That sounds good.
Negative.
You know who? But he’s deactivated!
Negative. Negative.
Primary mission: destroy Dungeon Dave. Activate.
His AI isn’t working. He’s reverted to his lower subroutines. We can’t control him anymore.
Now what do we do?
Take this debugger, it might help.
It’s no use. He’s too strong.
Isn’t there anyone you can call for help?
Your fathers?
No, they’d never forgive us for pretending to be kidnapped. There must be someone else.
Wait. Let me tweet.
Now isn’t the time to get on the internet!
No. My whistle.
Tweet Tweet.
The DM arrives.
Howdy Dave. Looks like you’re in a bit of a pickle.
Yeah, can you pull us out of a jam?
Of course my friend.
Rolling a D20.
Critical Hit
Critical hit! He falls into a bag of holding.
swoop!
Ah. That’s better.
Remember kids.
Anytime you need some help, just tweet your DM.
Thanks DM. Now back to you children.
Hey! We're all 17. We aren't children!
With coding skills like that you are. Didn’t you even unit test your safety modules.
I’m going to tell your fathers to send you to a good computer science department.
Thanks Dungeon Dave.
Aw shucks. Just call me Shirley.
The End

script.code:
ctx.restoreHP();
ctx.customDialog(["HP fully restored","Boom! It's action time!"],'bed');
